Roadmap 

Create questionnaire


Add questions


Provide attributes


Copy/paste and move questions


Test questionnaires

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Create questionnaire




Video




Click on CREATE NEW
Fill the required fields:

Questionnaire title. Name users see.
Questionnaire variable. Name system uses. See more here.

Click on CREATE.




Questionnaire title
How the questionnaire will be seen

In Designer, by developers
In HQ, by survey managers
In Interviewer, by interivewers

Questionnaire variable
Name used for main data file

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Add questions




Video



Two methods

Click ADD QUESTION button
Select Add question after from the right-click menu




While both methods add a question, they are subtly different:

ADD QUESTION adds a question at the end of the list of objects.
Add question after inserts a question where the user right-clicks

Choose the best method for the job.
See docs here

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Provide attributes




Video



Deconstruct PAPI

Choose best SuSo question type(s)
Identify SuSo components

Construct CAPI

Select Question type
Provide Variable name
Fill Question text
Provide other question type-specific attributes




Deconstruct PAPI

When choosing SuSo type, there may be a few options. Choose the one that best fits the need.
When identifying SuSo components:

Look at the PAPI components
Determine which of them belong where in SuSo
Order may be different in SuSo


Construct CAPI
Mostly copy-paste

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Copy/paste




Video



Copy

Right-click
Select Copy

Paste
Two methods:

Press PASTE button
Select Paste after from the right-click menu




Copy
Note: SuSo keeps copied object in the “clipboard”. No real need to copy again. Done in slides for purely pedagogical purposes.
Paste
As with creating questions, there is a subtle difference between the two methods

PASTE adds to the end of the object list
Paste after inserts after where the user right-clicks

Move to the left-hand margin until the cursor becomes

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Test questionnaire




Video




Click on TEST

If there are errors, Designer will provide a list. See more here.
If no errors, Designer will open a web-based tester in a new web browser tab. See more here.

Update the version of the questionnaire being tested by clicking

title: Learning Survey Solutions

Video

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
How

Line breaksParagraphs




Code:
This is some text
<br><br>
SOME TEXT AFTER A SPACE
Result:
This is some text  SOME TEXT AFTER A SPACE


Use the HTML <br> tag. See more here.
One <br> returns to the next line
Another <br> returns to another line, creating the effect of an empty line







Code:
<p>This is some paragraph text</p>
<p>SOME TEST AFTER A SPACE</p>
Result:

This is some paragraph text


SOME TEST AFTER A SPACE



Use the HTML

tag. See more here.
Upside: browser automatically adds a blank line before and after each tag
Downside: need to surround text with <p>

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
When

Units/instructionsLong text





What is [NAME]’s father’s main occupation ?  DESCRIBE IN A FEW WORDS E.G. PRIMARY SCHOOL TEACHER, BRICK LAYER, ETC.


What is [NAME]'s father’s main occupation ?
<br><br>
DESCRIBE IN A FEW WORDS 
E.G. PRIMARY SCHOOL TEACHER, BRICK LAYER, ETC.








Did your household purchase materials with the intention of undertaking the maintenance or repair of the household itself in the past 12 months?


Consider activities of repair and maintanance that have to be undertaken regularly in order to maintain the dwelling in good working order, that do not change the dwelling’s performance, capacity or expected service life and that, as such, are normally carried out by both owner occupiers and tenants



<p>
    Did your household purchase materials 
    with the intention of undertaking 
    the maintenance or repair of the household 
    itself in the past 12 months?
</p>

<p>
    Consider activities of repair and 
    maintanance that have to be undertaken 
    regularly in order to maintain the dwelling 
    in good working order, that do not change 
    the dwelling’s performance, capacity or 
    expected service life and that, as such, 
    are normally carried out by both 
    owner occupiers and tenants
</p>

Radio buttons

Less than 10 answer options
Answer list to be read aloud
Answer list not known / not amenable to search by typing


Combo box

More than 10 answer options
Interviewer knows that searching to be done
Answer list known / amenable to typing

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
General syntax
name_of_roster.Query(x=>x.var_to_query==1)






  
    
      Item
      Explanation
    
  
  
    name_of_roster
Name of the collection to query
    Query
Query operator
    x
Anonymous variable that captures the queried content
    x.var_to_query
Query variable(s); instance of that (those) variable(s)

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Common queries

AnyAllCount





Explanation: At least one element of the collection meets the query criteria.
Result: true/false.


// check whether there is any member designated as head
members.Any(x=>x.relationship == 1)

/*
Unpacking the expression above

members : roster ID for the target roster
x : anonymous variable to capture query results
x.relationship : query variable relationship in the roster








Explanation: All elements of the collection meet the query criteria
Result: true/false.



// all household members have a relationship to the head
// that is, the relationship variable is not `null`
members.All(x=>x.relationship != null)
NOTE: this is often a pre-condition for a condition.
See the full example in “Case 2” here







Explanation. Count the number of elements that meet the criteria
Result. Count.


// number of members designated as household head
members.Count(x=>x.relationship == 1)

Video




Find teas roster

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
No more than one head




Video




If member is head, confirm count of heads == 1
Otherwise, OK

title: Learning Survey Solutions
section: Age of child relative to head
text:
Age of child relative to head


Video


Case 1: if head, then no child w/ age diff < 13
Case 2: if child, then no head w/ age diff < 13
Case 3: if neither head nor child, OK

title: Learning Survey Solutions
section: Age of child relative to head
text:
Age of child relative to head


/* 
CONFIRM THAT THE AGE DIFFERENCE
BETWEEN THE HEAD AND CHILD IS APPROPRIATE
*/

// case 1: if head, no child in the roster whose age difference is too small
s01q03 == 1 ? !members.Any(x=>x.s01q03==3 && (s01q04_years - x.s01q04_years) < 13) :

// case 2: if child, no head whose age diffference is too small
s01q03 == 3 ? !members.Any(x=>x.s01q03==1 && (x.s01q04_years - s01q04_years) < 13) :

// case 3: if neither head nor child, OK
true

Unpacking the code

Ternary operator (? … :)

Before ? ~= if
Between ? and : ~= then
After : ~= else

!Any() == none
Variables with and without x. prefix

Without: current row (e.g. s01q03 == 1)
With: query target

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Example 1: household composition




Video



CAPI design 

Create two rosters

Different object
Different roster ID

But each roster points to same source
Place one part in one section
Place other part in another section

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Example 2: education




Video



PAPI process 

All member-level rosters are continuation of household composition
May filter to subset of members (e.g., age > 3)
But all member-level rosters

Carry forward members from household compostion
Include IDs of those members

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Example 2: education




Video



CAPI design 

Create education roster in new section

Different object
Different roster ID

But both rosters points to same source

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Summary

Each roster must have a unique name, but may share the same source
All rosters with the same source question are considered the same roster

Variables exist in same context
Data export in the same file

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Definition
Roster that:

Results from more than 1 round of enumerating things
Contains row IDs for each round of enumeration

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Example 1: Parcel-plot roster








PAPI process 

Parcels may contain 1 or more plots
Parcels are areas with the same management
Plots are areas with the same cropping pattern

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Example 2: Parcel-plot-crop roster








PAPI process 

Parcels may contain 1 or more plots
Plots may have 1 or more crops planted on it

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Single-select 






















Relationship

one option selected

Consumption
Two categorical questions:

Yes/no. Might imagine that this could be reused across several questions.
Units. Might benefit from being filtered as a function of the food item (e.g., g/kg for solids, mL/L for liquids, etc.)

Drinking water

Large set of answer options: 14
Might benefit from on-the-fly filtering (e.g., “pipe” -> first three options)

Cookstove fuel

Record order of selection also (i.e., in order of frequency)

Lack of money

Provide multiple answers
Record a yes or no for each item

Enabled. Default. Restricts input to integer values.
Disabled. Allows numbers with and without decimals. No limit on the number of decimal places.

When filled. Maximum number of decimal places allowed.

~~ ####

Sometimes unclear whether from paper instrument what the list should capture
In this case, description and location. Are these separate questions or information that could be gathered in a list.

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
How Survey Solutions’ conditions differ









Where to put it. Put on question to skip rather than question that triggers the skip.

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
How Survey Solutions’ conditions differ









Where to put it. Put on question to skip rather than question that triggers the skip.
What to expect as return value. Evaluate to TRUE/FALSE rather than an action (e.g., skip to question X).

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
How Survey Solutions’ conditions differ




Video




Where to put it. Put on question to skip rather than question that triggers the skip.
What to expect as return value. Evaluate to TRUE/FALSE rather than an action (e.g., skip to question X).
When evaluated. Evaluated continously throughout data entry session, with some default values.

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
What they do


Video

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Where to put them


Video

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
How they work




Video



Condition
// if the maximum answer value is answered...
IsAnswered(max_answer_value) ? 
// ... then limit the options to those whose value is less than or equal to it
@optioncode <= max_answer_value : 
// otherwise, show all options
true
Behavior

Depends on a logical condition that reference options
If true, enable option
If false (or null), disable
(If no condition, enabled by default)
See more details here

self <= 2
Behavior

Depends on a logical condition
If true, valid answer -> nothing happens
If false, invalide answer -> message and change in UI
(If no condition, valid by default)

title: Learning Survey Solutions
section: How Survey Solutions differs from other CAPI apps
text:
How Survey Solutions differs from other CAPI apps


// no more than 2 sessions are possible
self <= 2


Describe valid answers. Not invalid answers. Think assert in Stata.

title: Learning Survey Solutions
section: How Survey Solutions differs from other CAPI apps
text:
How Survey Solutions differs from other CAPI apps









Describe valid answers. Not invalid answers. Think assert in Stata.
No need to search for message. Messages are local to validations, not global to the application.

title: Learning Survey Solutions
section: How Survey Solutions differs from other CAPI apps
text:
How Survey Solutions differs from other CAPI apps




Video




Describe valid answers. Not invalid answers. Think assert in Stata.
No need to search for message. Messages are local to validations, not global to the application.
Impossible to block invalid answers. Design choice to allow invalid answers and not block fieldwork/data entry. No equivalent of CSPro’s reenter. But other mechanisms for dealing with invalid answers.

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Basic operators1


Relational

Equal: ==
Not-equal: !=
And the rest: >, >=, <=, <



Logical

And: &&
Or: ||
Not: !



Mathematical

Add: +
Subtract: -
Multiply: *
Divide: %



See more here. For example, the ternary operator is quite useful.

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Comments


Inline
// this is a comment
x == 1


Block
/* 
this
is a block
comment
*/

x == 1


Both
/* 
this
is a block
comment
*/

// this is another comment
x == 1

q06 == 7

text:
Categorical: single-select
InRange








// administer B20 when the household member is married (i.e., answer 1 or 2 to B19)
hh_b19.InRange(1,2)

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Categorical: single-select
InList








// enable question 6 when answer is 1, 4, or 5 is chosen for question 4
ag_q4.InList(1,4,5)

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Categorical: single-select
IsNoneOf









With InRange, identify those values that enable F13
// enable F13 if one of these answers selected for F12
hh_f12.InRange(3,10)


With IsNoneOf, identify those values that do NOT enable F13
// enable F13 if no firewood option is chosen for F12
hh_f12.IsNoneOf(1,2)

title: Learning Survey Solutions
Learning Survey Solutions
text:
What is a variable









Question answered by a computer rather than interviewer

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
What is a variable














Question answered by a computer rather than interviewer
Object whose value is evaluated by an expression

Static expression (e.g., a fixed string value that depends on nothing)
Dynamic expression (e.g., a computation whose values derives from one or more question)

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Why use a variable









Computer can answer questions more reliably than a person (e.g., ENUMERATOR: CHECK...)

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Why use a variable









Computer can answer questions more reliably than a person (e.g., ENUMERATOR: CHECK...)
Value of an expression needs to be saved (e.g., randomization)

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Why use a variable














Computer can answer questions more reliably than a person (e.g., ENUMERATOR: CHECK...)
Value of an expression needs to be saved (e.g., randomization)
Value of an expression is used in other expressions

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:

Video






Create a variable


Click on ADD VARIABLE button or
Right-click and select Add variable after




Select the (data) type


Boolean
Double
Date/Time
Long integer
String


Give the usual attributes

Variable name
Variable label

Define its value with an expression that yield a value of the expected data type
(Optionally) Select whether not to export (default: export)

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
For field operations

Interviewer. Complete interviews,
Supervisor. Reassign work, review interviews.
Headquarters. Manages survey:

Creates users (i.e., Interviewer, Supervisor)
Imports interviews
Creates assignments
Reviews interviews
Exports data

Observer. Like Headquarters, but can only observe.

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
For technical tasks

Admin. Like “super” Headquarters.

Can do everything Headquarters can.
Can do things Headquarters cannot:

Create workspaces.
Create all users (including Headquarters).


API. Like “super” Headquarters, but through API rather than GUI

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
What


Fact 1: Headquarters distributes questionnaires


Fact 2: Questionnaires need to come from somewhere


Fact 3: Designer is that somewhere


Fact 4: Importing copies a questionnaire snapshot from Designer to Headquarters


Fact 5: Headquarters manages several different questionnaire snapshots as versions

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Why



Get started 

During initial server, must import questionnaire before assignments can be made.





Update 

When changes happen to the questionnaire, must import changes from Designer to Headquarters (e.g., add questions, correct conditions, etc.)





Test 

When developing, may want to import to test (e.g., see how works on Interviewer, distribute tests to tablets, etc.)

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Modify inputs


Objectives 🎯
TODO: list requirements for raw -> assignment
For ZiHBS example:

Load raw data
Transform character provience to categorical


TODO: adapt code to example created for slides


* =============================================================================
* Set paths
* =============================================================================

* !!! WARNING !!! Put your paths here before executing
local dir_in "C:/your/path"
local dir_out "`dir_in'"

* =============================================================================
* Data preparation
* =============================================================================

* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
* Import the sample to be assigned
* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

import delimited using "`dir_in'/example_sample.tsv", ///
    varnames(1) /// treat first line as variable names
    clear

* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
* Transform columns into those expected by SuSo
* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* convert from numeric to string
rename province province_old
gen province = 
gen days_preferred = .

replace province = 1 if province_old == "Bulawayo
replace province = 2 if province_old == "Harare
replace province = 3 if province_old == "Manicaland
replace province = 4 if province_old == "Mashonaland Central
replace province = 5 if province_old == "Mashonaland East
replace province = 6 if province_old == "Mashonaland West
replace province = 7 if province_old == "Masvingo
replace province = 8 if province_old == "Matabeleland North
replace province = 9 if province_old == "Matabeleland South
replace province = 10 if province_old == "Midlands

* rename variables to match expected name

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Export tab-delimited output


Objectives 🎯

Export to tab-delimited format
Save where expected




* =============================================================================
* Export to a tab-delimited file
* =============================================================================

export delimited using 
    "`dir_out'/assignments_to_import.tab", /// where to write the file
    delimiter(tab)  /// tab-delimited format
    nolabel         /// how to handle labelled data: write numbers; not labels
    replace
